Android Phones For Dummies - 4th Edition (2016) (Pdf) Gooner

Publisher: John Wiley & Sons; 4th edition (9 Nov. 2016)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 1119310687
ISBN-13: 978-1119310686

Your fullâ€“color guide to putting your Android to work for you.

Your smartphone is essentially your lifeline so itâ€²s no wonder you chose a simpleâ€“toâ€“use, funâ€“toâ€“customize, and easyâ€“toâ€“operate Android. Cutting through intimidating jargon and covering all the features you need to know about your Android phone, this downâ€“toâ€“earth guide arms you with the knowledge to set up and configure your device, get up and running with texting and emailing, access the Internet, navigate with GPS, sync with a PC, and so much more.

Whether youâ€²re new to Android phones or have just upgraded to a new model, Android Phones For Dummies makes it fast and easy to make your new smartphone your minion. Written by bestselling author Dan Gookin, it walks you through the basics in a language you can understand before moving on to more advanced topics, like dialing tricks to forward calls, working with predictive text, accessing special characters, manipulating the touch screen, and using a USB connection to synchronize your stuff.

* Set up your phone and configure its settings

* Play games, listen to music, and start shooting photos and videos

* Join the conversation and have fun with social media

* Make your life easier with Google Voice typing

No matter how you slice it, life with an Android phone is more organized and fun and this book shows you how to make the most of it
